title: Shonda Rhimes Sells Los Angeles Home for $7.16 Million
text:
Television producer and writer Shonda Rhimes, who is behind hit TV shows including "Grey’s Anatomy," "Scandal," and "How To Get Away With Murder,” sold her home in Los Angeles’s Hancock Park neighborhood on Friday for $7.16 million, according to listing records.



Ms. Rhimes, 49, first tried to part with the six-bedroom home in October 2018 for $10 million, but it would take two price cuts, with the asking price eventually landing at $8.5 million in May, before a buyer was found.

Mansion Global could not determine who purchased the home.



Built in 1924, and occupying a gated corner lot, the traditional-style house has hardwood floors, crown molding, a library and music room, an open-plan kitchen, dining and family room, and a master suite with two walk-in closets and a study, according to the listing with Berkshire Hathaway HomeServices California. A representative from the brokerage did not immediately respond to a request for comment.



Outside in the tiered yard is an entertaining space, a pool and an adjacent cabana.



Ms. Rhimes bought the home in 2010 for $5.6 million, records with PropertyShark show. She used a trust for the purchase.



During her tenure, Ms. Rhimes darkened the wooden floors and converted the pool cabana, which had been used as a recording studio, back to its original use, according to the Wall Street Journal.

The producer appears to be fond of Hancock Park, a historic neighborhood known for its 1920s-era homes. In 2017, she spent $4.59 million on a two-story, English Country-style home in the area, Mansion Global previously reported.



At the end of last year Ms. Rhimes expanded her portfolio even further, adding a two-bedroom penthouse on Manhattan’s Upper East Side. She paid $11.75 million for the unit along with two accompanying maid’s rooms in a Rosario Candela-designed building on posh Park Avenue.



A representative for Ms. Rhimes did not immediately respond to a request for comment.



The Los Angeles Times first reported the sale.
